item.title: Cryptography Primer Zero
item.description: ELI0 Cryptography : Digital Signatures A 300B$ industry In this series of post I will try to shed the light on a few cryptography concepts and algorithms , explaining the mathematics behind them and trying to explain intuitively how it all works . If you find any mistakes you’re welcome to mention it by email . We start with Digital Signatures the backbone of every crypto(currency) out there .

item.title: You Cant Beat Visa
item.description: In a white paper or a marketing brochure somewhere there’s a common sentence “Visa processes 7000 TPS” the actual number is more like 1600 TPS and Visa says they can handle more The sell pitch is usually scalable more transactions per seconds , this blog post is going to deconstruct this and convince you that , if you want decentralized you can’t do visa type of transactions . item.title: Transactions as Puzzles : How to think about Bitcoin and Ethereum ledgers
item.description: Bitcoin is digital P2P cash , the important part here is cash, unlike other models of transfer of value Bitcoin transactions are difficult to think about and model (do you actually know how it works ?) . ethereum ledger is similar to a what a bank database may look like . It has a set of accounts and the ledger stores states at each block (bitcoin stores the state transition), each new block represents essentially the result of a state transformation .
